title: condensed film poster type
content:

working on some horror posters at the moment and trying to get the film credit look with the fonts. can anyone point me in the right direction?

comments.content: You could try something like [Univers Ultra Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142710/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=LH.108137.0.18)
just quietly, i quite liked your myriad condensed versions....

Or [URW Bee](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142710/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1&totalrecords=8&searchby=&searchID=&searchletter=&searchstr=bee-&font_categories_checkbox=font_name_search&fontRendererText=ALFRED+HITCHCOCK+week++++HACKNEY+HORROR+FILM+FESTIVAL).

Nice posters! I recommend using extra space rather than bullets as separators.

They sure look great already. Very nice.  
As for ’film credit type’, you may also like ’ [Ohrada](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142710/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-32-ohrada-normalstock)’, by František Štorm.

_[typophile.com/node/5267](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142710/http:/typophile.com/node/5267)_

Dav

appreciate the help.

bee is a fantastic font isn’t it? never seen it before

I really like the bird poster.

But a quick suggestion: try playing around with the layout of the birds that make up “HORROR” so they seem a little more random. (i.e. so the birds that make up the R’s aren’t in the same positions in both letters.)
